tweet: Ontario is conducting a new COVID-19 safety campaign focusing on warehouses, distribution centres, manufacturers and food processing plants.  About 1,500 hot-spot workplaces are being visted between May 10-28.  Learn more:  https://t.co/EBUURWrZgm  https://t.co/RYLKbfcu31

name: Doug Ford
tweet: Every day, we see domestic flights landing in Ontario with COVID-positive travellers. This is not just an Ontario problem‚Äîthis is an issue all provinces are struggling with. name: Doug Ford

name: Doug Ford
tweet: This 3rd wave has been fuelled almost entirely by variants that passed too easily through our borders. Right now, we have people easily exploiting well-known loopholes that have been left in place.   This is unacceptable. We need action now to protect Ontarians.  https://t.co/MO9a7BJqKd

name: Doug Ford

name: Doug Ford

name: Doug Ford

name: Doug Ford

name: Doug Ford
tweet: I want to send out a big thank you to Ontario's incredible nurses. You are absolute champions.   Our nurses make a difference in the lives of countless patients and families every day.   This #NursesWeek2021, we thank you for your dedication, compassion & courage.  https://t.co/9awD3IWoHl

name: Doug Ford
tweet: Thank you Mayor @patrickbrownont for speaking up for Ontario.  COVID-19 variants have caused a devastating 3rd wave in Ontario. Back in January, a B.1.1.7 variant outbreak at Roberta place led to the death of 71 residents. Now, the majority of cases are new, deadly variants.

name: Doug Ford
tweet: The sooner we stop letting variants enter into Canada, the sooner we can get ahead of this virus.   Ontarians have made tremendous sacrifices in our fight against COVID-19. It‚Äôs not fair that we continue to put the onus on Ontarians, when we continue to import cases from abroad.  https://t.co/NHK7SXI8Lw

name: Doug Ford
tweet: Last year, the federal government failed to stop the UK variant from getting into Ontario. Now, the UK variant has become the dominant strain in Ontario.   If our border measures were in-fact among the 'strongest in the world,‚Äô we wouldn‚Äôt find ourselves in this position.  https://t.co/eA8X76nku5

name: Doug Ford
tweet: Yesterday, Ontario administered 141,038 vaccines ‚Äî a new record!  With over 5.7 million doses administered to-date, we are making great progress thanks to the hard work of our front line health care heroes. Let‚Äôs keep it up #TeamOntario!

name: Doug Ford
tweet: Last Thursday, I appealed directly to Prime Minister @JustinTrudeau requesting immediate action on the borders.  Almost every day, planes carry multiple people infected with COVID-19 variants & expose an unknown number of other travellers along the way.  We need action now.  https://t.co/hHAOgxOs4I

name: Doug Ford
tweet: In the last two weeks, we have sent the federal government 3 urgent letters requesting immediate action on the borders.  More can and must be done. We cannot sit back and watch the fourth wave of COVID-19 walk across our border.  https://t.co/9N0rFOmq04

name: Doug Ford
tweet: I have been calling for stronger border measures well before the 3rd wave started.  It‚Äôs clear that our border measures have not gone far enough to keep us safe. We have asked Ontarians to make so many sacrifices, it‚Äôs time we demand the same from non-essential travellers.  https://t.co/augmVJF7QG

name: Doug Ford
tweet: I'm extremely concerned about new COVID variants making their way into Ontario.  Over 90% of new cases in Ontario are new variants. We're seeing more young people in ICUs.  It‚Äôs clear stronger border measures are needed.  https://t.co/vCuwy2QmQb
